$eref.description: An article, such as a news article or piece of investigative report. Newspapers and magazines have articles of many different types and this is intended to cover them all. Schema.org: http://schema.org/Article

___articleSection.description: Articles may belong to one or more 'sections' in a magazine or newspaper, such as Sports, Lifestyle, etc.

___pageStart.description: The page on which the work starts; for example '138' or 'xvi'.

___pagination.description: Any description of pages that is not separated into pageStart and pageEnd; for example, '1-6, 9, 55' or '10-12, 46-49'.

___wordCount.description: The number of words in the text of the Article.

___pageEnd.description: The page on which the work ends; for example '138' or 'xvi'.

___articleBody.description: The actual body of the article.

___printColumn.description: The number of the column in which the NewsArticle appears in the print edition.

___printPage.description: If this NewsArticle appears in print, this field indicates the name of the page on which the article is found. Please note that this field is intended for the exact page name (e.g. A5, B18).

___printSection.description: If this NewsArticle appears in print, this field indicates the print section in which the article appeared.

___printEdition.description: The edition of the print product in which the NewsArticle appears.

___dateline.description: The location where the NewsArticle was produced.
